API Reference#

Profile#

create_profile(method: str, start: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, stop: Optional[numpy.ndarray] = None, shapefile: Optional[str] = None, num=100, shp_num_points: Optional[int] = None, **kwargs)[source]#

Create a pandas DataFrame of points along a line with multiple methods.

Parameters

  • method (str) ‚Äì Choose sampling method, either ‚Äúpoints‚Äù or ‚Äúshapefile‚Äù

  • start (np.ndarray, optional) ‚Äì Coordinates for starting point of profile, by default None

  • stop (np.ndarray, optional) ‚Äì Coordinates for eding point of profile, by default None

  • num (int, optional) ‚Äì Number of points between start and stop, by default 100

  • shp_num_points (int, optional) ‚Äì Number of points to resample shapefile to, by default None

  • shapefile (str, optional) ‚Äì shapefile file name to create points along, by default None

Returns

Dataframe with ‚Äòx‚Äô, ‚Äòy‚Äô, and ‚Äòdist‚Äô columns for points along line or shapefile path.

Return type

pd.Dataframe

default_data(region=None) → dict[source]#

Fetch default gravity and magnetic datasets.

Parameters

region (str or list[int], optional) ‚Äì region of Antarctic to load, by default is entire Antarctic region.

Returns

Nested dictionary of data and attributes

Return type

dict[dict]

default_layers() → dict[source]#

Fetch default Bedmap2 layers.

Returns

Nested dictionary of Bedmap2 layers and attributes

Return type

dict[dict]

fill_nans(df)[source]#

Fill NaN‚Äôs in sampled layer with values from above layer.

Parameters

df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì First 3 columns as they are assumed to by x, y, dist.

Returns

Dataframe with NaN‚Äôs of lower layers filled

Return type

pd.DataFrame

make_data_dict(names: list, grids: list, colors: list) → dict[source]#

Create nested dictionary of data and attributes

Parameters

  • names (list[str]) ‚Äì data names

  • grids (list[str or xarray.DataArray]) ‚Äì files or xarray.DataArray‚Äôs

  • colors (list[str]) ‚Äì colors to plot data

Returns

Nested dictionaries of grids and attributes

Return type

dict[dict]

plot_profile(method: str, layers_dict: Optional[dict] = None, data_dict: Optional[dict] = None, add_map: bool = False, **kwargs)[source]#

Show sampled layers and/or data on a cross section, with an optional location map.

Parameters

  • method (str) ‚Äì Choose the sample method, either ‚Äòpoints‚Äô, or ‚Äòshapefile‚Äô.

  • layers_dict (dict, optional) ‚Äì nested dictionary of layers to include in cross-section, construct with profile.make_data_dict, by default is Bedmap2 layers.

  • data_dict (dict, optional) ‚Äì nested dictionary of data to include in option graph, construct with profile.make_data_dict, by default is gravity and magnetic anomalies.

  • add_map (bool = False) ‚Äì Choose whether to add a location map, by default is False.

  • fillnans (bool) ‚Äì Choose whether to fill nans in layers, defaults to True

  • clip (bool) ‚Äì Choose whether to clip the profile based on distance

  • max_dist (int) ‚Äì Clip all distances greater than.

  • min_dist (int) ‚Äì Clip all distances less than.

  • **kwargs (dict) ‚Äì

    map_background: str or xarray.DataArray

    Change the map background by passing a filename string or grid, by default is imagery.

    map_cmap: str

    Change the map colorscale by passing a valid GMT cmap string, by default is ‚Äòearth‚Äô.

    map_buffer: float (0-1)

    Change map zoom as relative percentage of profile length, by default is 0.2

    layer_buffer: float (0-1)

    Change vertical white space within cross-section, by default is 0.1

    data_buffer: float (0-1)

    Change vertical white space within data graph, by default is 0.1

    save: bool

    Choose to save the image, by default is False

    path: str

    Filename for saving image, by default is None.

sample_grids(df, grid, name: Optional[str] = None)[source]#

Sample data at every point along a line

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì Dataframe containing columns ‚Äòx‚Äô, ‚Äòy‚Äô

  • grid (str or xr.DataArray) ‚Äì Grid to sample, either file name or xr.DataArray

  • name (str, optional) ‚Äì Name for sampled column, by default is str(grid)

Returns

Dataframe with new column (name) of sample values from (grid)

Return type

pd.DataFrame

shorten(df, max_dist=None, min_dist=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Shorten a dataframe at either end based on distance column.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì Dataframe to shorten and recalculate distance, must contain ‚Äòx‚Äô, ‚Äòy‚Äô, ‚Äòdist‚Äô

  • max_dist (int, optional) ‚Äì remove rows with dist>max_dist, by default None

  • min_dist (int, optional) ‚Äì remove rows with dist<min_dist, by default None

Returns

Shortened dataframe

Return type

pd.DataFrame

Fetch#

basement(plot: bool = False, info: bool = False) → xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray[source]#

Load a grid of basement topography. Offshore and sub-Ross Ice Shelf basement topography. from Tankersley et al. 2022: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1029/2021GL097371 offshore data from Lindeque et al. 2016: https://doi.org/10.1002/2016GC006401

Parameters

  • plot (bool, optional) ‚Äì plot the fetched grid, by default False

  • info (bool, optional) ‚Äì print info on the fetched grid, by default False

Returns

dataarray of basement depths

Return type

xr.DataArray

bedmap2(layer: str, plot: bool = False, info: bool = False) → xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray[source]#

Load bedmap2 data. Note, nan‚Äôs in surface grid are set to 0. from https://doi.org/10.5194/tc-7-375-2013.

Parameters

  • layer (str) ‚Äì choose which layer to fetch, ‚Äòthickness‚Äô, ‚Äòbed‚Äô, ‚Äòsurface‚Äô, or ‚Äògeiod_to_WGS84‚Äô

  • plot (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose to plot grid, by default False

  • info (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose to print info on grid, by default False

Returns

Returns a bedmap2 grid

Return type

xr.DataArray

deepbedmap(plot: bool = False, info: bool = False, region=None, spacing=10000.0) → xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray[source]#

Load DeepBedMap data, from Leong and Horgan, 2020: https://doi.org/10.5194/tc-14-3687-2020 Accessed from https://zenodo.org/record/4054246#.Ysy344RByp0

Parameters

  • plot (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose to plot grid, by default False

  • info (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose to print info on grid, by default False

  • region (str or np.ndarray, optional) ‚Äì GMT-format region to clip the loaded grid to, by default doesn‚Äôt clip

  • spacing (str or int, optional) ‚Äì grid spacing to resample the loaded grid to, by default 10e3

Returns

Returns a loaded, and optional clip/resampled grid of DeepBedMap.

Return type

xr.DataArray

gravity(type: str, plot: bool = False, info: bool = False, region=None, spacing=10000.0) → xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray[source]#

Loads an Antarctic gravity grid Preliminary compilation of Antarctica gravity and gravity gradient data. Updates on 2016 AntGG compilation. Accessed from https://ftp.space.dtu.dk/pub/RF/4D-ANTARCTICA/.

Parameters

  • type (str) ‚Äì either ‚ÄòFA‚Äô or ‚ÄòBA‚Äô, for free-air and bouguer anomalies, respectively.

  • plot (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose to plot grid, by default False

  • info (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose to print info on grid, by default False

  • region (str or np.ndarray, optional) ‚Äì GMT-format region to clip the loaded grid to, by default doesn‚Äôt clip

  • spacing (str or int, optional) ‚Äì grid spacing to resample the loaded grid to, by default 10e3

Returns

Returns a loaded, and optional clip/resampled grid of either free-air or Bouguer gravity anomalies.

Return type

xr.DataArray

groundingline() → str[source]#

Load the file path of a groundingline shapefile Antarctic groundingline shape file, from https://doi.pangaea.de/10.1594/PANGAEA.819147 Supplement to Depoorter et al. 2013: https://doi.org/10.1038/nature12567

Returns

file path

Return type

str

imagery() → str[source]#

Load the file path of Antarctic imagery geotiff from LIMA: https://lima.usgs.gov/fullcontinent.php will replace with below once figured out login issue with pooch MODIS Mosaic of Antarctica: https://doi.org/10.5067/68TBT0CGJSOJ Assessed from https://daacdata.apps.nsidc.org/pub/DATASETS/nsidc0730_MEASURES_MOA2014_v01/geotiff/

Returns

file path

Return type

str

magnetics(version: str, plot: bool = False, info: bool = False, region=None, spacing=10000.0) → xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray[source]#

Load 1 of 4 ‚Äòversions‚Äô of Antarctic magnetic anomaly grid. version=‚Äôadmap2‚Äô ADMAP2 magnetic anomaly compilation of Antarctica. Non-geosoft specific files provide from Sasha Golynsky. version=‚Äôadmap1‚Äô ADMAP-2001 magnetic anomaly compilation of Antarctica. https://admap.kongju.ac.kr/databases.html version=‚Äôadmap2_eq_src‚Äô ADMAP2 eqivalent sources, from https://admap.kongju.ac.kr/admapdata/ version=‚Äôadmap2_gdb‚Äô Geosoft-specific .gdb abridged files. Accessed from https://doi.pangaea.de/10.1594/PANGAEA.892722?format=html#download

Parameters

  • version (str) ‚Äì Either ‚Äòadmap2‚Äô, ‚Äòadmap1‚Äô, ‚Äòadmap2_eq_src‚Äô, or ‚Äòadmap2_gdb‚Äô

  • plot (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose to plot grid, by default False

  • info (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose to print info on grid, by default False

  • region (str or np.ndarray, optional) ‚Äì GMT-format region to clip the loaded grid to, by default doesn‚Äôt clip

  • spacing (str or int, optional) ‚Äì grid spacing to resample the loaded grid to, by default 10e3

Returns

Returns a loaded, and optional clip/resampled grid of magnetic anomalies.

Return type

xr.DataArray

sample_shp(name: str) → str[source]#

Load the file path of sample shapefiles

Parameters

name (str) ‚Äì chose which sample shapefile to load, either ‚ÄòDisco_deep_transect‚Äô or ‚ÄòRoosevelt_Island‚Äô

Returns

file path as a string

Return type

str

Utils#

GMT_reg_xy_to_ll(input)[source]#

Convert GMT region string [e, w, n, s] in EPSG:3031 to deg:min:sec

Parameters

input (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Array of 4 strings in GMT format; [e, w, n, s] in meters

Returns

Array of 4 strings in GMT format; [e, w, n, s] in lat, lon

Return type

np.ndarray

dd2dms(dd: float)[source]#

Convert decimal degrees to minutes, seconds. Modified from https://stackoverflow.com/a/10286690/18686384

Parameters

dd (float) ‚Äì input decimal degrees

Returns

degrees in the format ‚ÄúDD:MM:SS‚Äù

Return type

str

epsg3031_to_latlon(df, reg: bool = False, input=['x', 'y'], output=['lon', 'lat'])[source]#

Convert coordinates from EPSG:3031 Antarctic Polar Stereographic in meters to EPSG:4326 WGS84 in decimal degrees.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì input dataframe with easting and northing columns

  • reg (bool, optional) ‚Äì if true, returns a GMT formatted region string, by default False

  • input (list, optional) ‚Äì set names for input columns, by default [‚Äúx‚Äù, ‚Äúy‚Äù]

  • output (list, optional) ‚Äì set names for output columns, by default [‚Äúlon‚Äù, ‚Äúlat‚Äù]

Returns

Updated dataframe with new latitude and longitude columns or np.ndarray in format [e, w, n, s]

Return type

pd.DataFrame or np.ndarray

get_grid_info(grid)[source]#

Returns the spacing and region of an input grid.

Parameters

grid (str or xarray.DataArray) ‚Äì Input grid to get info from. Filename string or loaded grid.

Returns

tuple, first item is a string of grid spacing, second item is an array with the region boundaries

Return type

tuple

latlon_to_epsg3031(df, reg: bool = False, input=['lon', 'lat'], output=['x', 'y'])[source]#

Convert coordinates from EPSG:4326 WGS84 in decimal degrees to EPSG:3031 Antarctic Polar Stereographic in meters.

Parameters

  • df (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì input dataframe with latitude and longitude columns

  • reg (bool, optional) ‚Äì if true, returns a GMT formatted region string, by default False

  • input (list, optional) ‚Äì set names for input columns, by default [‚Äúlon‚Äù, ‚Äúlat‚Äù]

  • output (list, optional) ‚Äì set names for output columns, by default [‚Äúx‚Äù, ‚Äúy‚Äù]

Returns

Updated dataframe with new easting and northing columns or np.ndarray in format [e, w, n, s]

Return type

pd.DataFrame or np.ndarray

mask_from_shp(shapefile: str, invert: bool = True, xr_grid=None, grid_file: Optional[str] = None, region=None, spacing=None, masked: bool = False, crs: str = 'epsg:3031')[source]#

Create a mask or a masked grid from area inside or outside of a closed shapefile.

Parameters

  • shapefile (str) ‚Äì path to .shp filename, must by in same directory as accompanying files : .shx, .prj, .dbf, should be a closed polygon file.

  • invert (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose whether to mask data outside the shape (False) or inside the shape (True), by default True (masks inside of shape)

  • xr_grid (xarray.DataArray, optional) ‚Äì _xarray.DataArray; to use to define region, or to mask, by default None

  • grid_file (str, optional) ‚Äì path to a .nc or .tif file to use to define region or to mask, by default None

  • region (str or np.ndarray, optional) ‚Äì GMT region string or 1x4 ndarray in meters to create a dummy grid if none are supplied, by default None

  • spacing (str or int, optional) ‚Äì grid spacing in meters to create a dummy grid if none are supplied, by default None

  • masked (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose whether to return the masked grid (True) or the mask itself (False), by default False

  • crs (str, optional) ‚Äì if grid is provided, rasterio needs to assign a coordinate reference system via an epsg code, by default ‚Äúepsg:3031‚Äù

Returns

Returns either a masked grid, or the mask grid itself.

Return type

xarray.DataArray

plot_grd(grid, cmap: str, cbar_label: str, plot_region=None, cmap_region=None, coast=False, grd2cpt_name=False, origin_shift='initialize')[source]#

Function to automate PyGMT plotting

Parameters

  • grid (str or xarray.DataArray) ‚Äì grid to plot.

  • cmap (str) ‚Äì GMT colorscale to use.

  • cbar_label (str) ‚Äì label to add to colorbar.

  • plot_region (str or np.ndarray, optional) ‚Äì GMT region to set map extent to, by default is entire Antarctic region

  • cmap_region (str or np.ndarray, optional) ‚Äì GMT region to define the color scale limits, by default is equal to plot_region

  • coast (bool, optional) ‚Äì choose to plot coastline and groundingline, by default False

  • grd2cpt_name (bool, optional) ‚Äì file name which will be given to a cpt create with pygmt.grd2cpt() and used in the plot, by default False

  • origin_shift (str, optional) ‚Äì choose whether to start a new figure:‚Äôinitialize‚Äô, create a new subplot to the right:‚Äôxshift‚Äô, or create a new subplot above:‚Äôyshift‚Äô, by default ‚Äúinitialize‚Äù

reg_str_to_df(input, names=['x', 'y'])[source]#

Convert GMT region string [e, w, n, s] to pandas dataframe with coordinates of region corners

Parameters

  • input (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Array of 4 strings in GMT format; [e, w, n, s]

  • names (list, optional) ‚Äì Names of names to use for easting and northing, by default [‚Äúx‚Äù, ‚Äúy‚Äù]

Returns

Dataframe with easting and northing columns, and a row for each corner of the region.

Return type

pd.DataFrame
